string_data:
PRIMARY: Eight Greenpeace activists climbed two 75-meter high chimney stacks at Staythorpe Power Station in Nottinghamshire to protest gas's role in setting electricity prices. All eight were arrested for aggravated trespassing and released on bail.

SECONDARY: Four additional people were subsequently arrested on suspicion of interfering with key national infrastructure operations, suggesting related secondary protest activity.

OTHER FOCAL: The article focuses primarily on the arrest details and police response rather than broader energy policy issues.

TONE: The article maintains a neutral, factual tone typical of BBC news reporting.
